gametools

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • gametools.Item
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sprite

    public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    Used for basic positioning and collision.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CL_INSIDE
      Collision when the first object is completely within the second.
      static int CL_INSIDE_X
      Collision when the first object is completely within the second horizontally, no matter the vertical position.
      static int CL_INSIDE_Y
      Collision when the first object is completely within the second vertically, no matter the horizontal position.
      static int CL_TOUCH
      Collision when the first object has any point within the second.
      static int CL_TOUCH_X
      Collision when the first object has any point within the second horizontally, no matter the vertical position.
      static int CL_TOUCH_Y
      Collision when the first object has any point within the second vertically, no matter the horizontal position.
      protected int height
      The height of the object (usually the height of the object's associated image if it exists).
      static Item UNDEFINED_ITEM
      An empty item to represent a non existent or undefined object.
      protected int width
      The width of the object (usually the width of the object's associated image if it exists).
      protected double x
      The precise x position of the object.
      protected double y
      The precise y position of the object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Item()
      Creates an item with the coordinates and dimensions of zero.
      Item(java.awt.Dimension size)
      Creates an item with custom dimensions and coordinates of zero.
      Item(double x, double y, int width, int height)
      Creates an item at the x and y with the specified dimensions.
      Item(int width, int height)
      Creates an item with custom dimensions and coordinates of zero.
      Item(Location location)
      Creates an item on the specified location with dimensions of zero.
      Item(Location location, java.awt.Dimension size)
      Creates an item at the x and y with the specified dimensions.

      Checks if the object is colliding with another item or area using rectangular collision and touch collision as the collision testing method.

      Checks if the object is colliding with another item or area using rectangular collision and a custom collision flag.
      void setLocation(double x, double y)
      Sets the x and y position of the object.
      void setLocation(Location location)
      Sets the x and y position of the object using a location.

      Sets the x position of the object.

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns:
        The x position of the object.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns:
        The y position of the object.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the object. In sprites this is automatically set to be the width of the sprite image.
        Returns:
        The width of the object.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the object. In sprites this is automatically set to be the height of the sprite image.
        Returns:
        The height of the object.

      • getLocation

        public Location getLocation()
        Returns:
        A point representing the current position of the object.

      • getDimensions

        public java.awt.Dimension getDimensions()
        Returns:
        A dimension representing the current width and height of the object.

      • getCenter

        public Location getCenter()
        Returns:
        A point representing the center of the object.

        Sets the x position of the object.

        x - The new x position.

        public final void setY(double y)
        Sets the y position of the object.
        Parameters:
        y - The new y position.

      • setLocation

        public final void setLocation(Location location)
        Sets the x and y position of the object using a location.
        Parameters:
        location - The new location for the item.

      • setLocation

                              double y)
        Sets the x and y position of the object.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x position.
        y - The new y position.

      • isWithin

        public boolean isWithin(Item item)
        Checks if the object is colliding with another item or area using rectangular collision and touch collision as the collision testing method.
        Parameters:
        item - The object to test collision against.
        Returns:
        True if the objects are in contact.

      • isWithin

        public boolean isWithin(Item item,
                        int method)
        Checks if the object is colliding with another item or area using rectangular collision and a custom collision flag.
        Parameters:
        item - The object to test collision against.
        method - The collision testing method to use.
        Returns:
        True if the objects are in contact.
